alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 6:44PM MST until August 08 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MST THIS EVENING NEAR BLACK CANYON CITY IN YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 641 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain from thunderstorms has ended across the warned area. However, flash flooding is still expected as rain water drains through Squaw Creek and into the Agua Fria River. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Black Canyon City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 near mile marker 243. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Copper Creek, Larry Creek, Squaw Creek, East Branch Squaw Creek, New River, Agua Fria River, Little Squaw Creek, Ash Spring Creek and Middle Fork Squaw Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
